nodes.text:
You've done excellent work, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. And you've earned yourself an opportunity to do more.

Meet your real client. I don't believe that she needs an introduction.

I'm happy to see you again, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. Or… should I say Commander?

You've done well for yourself. The old man would be pleased.

It must come as a shock to you, seeing us here at Alloway. Seeing us at all. I apologize for that, but I had to be sure that you were the MechWarrior I remembered before I reached out to you. And now, with the Scheria on its way to [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLyreton],Lyreton]] for repairs, I know. You are everything I remember and more.

branches.responseText: None of that matters, Lady Arano. I'm just happy to see you alive.
I can't believe you're standing here. The entire Reach is convinced that you're dead.
I'm "everything you remember" ? You show up after three years, and that's all that you have to say to me?

nodes.text: Yes, but… how? Forgive me, Lady Arano, but you're supposed to be dead. Lord Madeira, too. The news feeds ran footage of your DropShip getting blown out of the sky, on a loop, for months.

That wasn't her DropShip. The broadcasts of her death were Directorate propaganda—well-crafted lies to keep the masses in line.

And with that, Kamea, I'll leave you to your reunion. Best of luck with the negotiations, and keep me apprised of whatever decision you come to.
She was dead! Lord Madeira, too! I'm sorry, Lady Arano, but the news feeds ran footage of your DropShip getting blown out of the sky… on a loop… for months!

Go easy on her, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}… she's been living in exile since Espinosa stole her throne. The broadcasts of her death were Directorate propaganda. Well-crafted lies to keep the masses in line.

And with that, Kamea, I'll leave you to your reunion. Best of luck with the negotiations, and keep me apprised of whatever decision you come to.
[Lady Centrella's face winks off of the viewscreen. The dull blue glow of her Holo projection slowly dies away.]

Lady Centrella was right about the propaganda, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. My uncle's Directorate is run on lies… though in this case, they very nearly became true.

The Directorate's assassins pursued us into the Frontier. In the months following the coup, we had more than our share of close calls. Eventually, they gave up looking for us, and we've been living in exile ever since.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Origin: Exiled]</color> I know what that's like—I've been there myself. Where have the two of you been hiding?
Where have the two of you been hiding?
You had Centrella send us after the Scheria. I'd like to know why.
You could have contacted me. You know I'd have come.
Okay. You made it off of Coromodir, and you've found me. Let's talk about why.

nodes.text:
As far from Directorate space as we could get without leaving the Frontier—a miserable little ball of rock called Zathras.

It was a nasty, brutish planet, full of internecine strife and bloody turmoil. There were power struggles and mad nobles, plagues and zealots and holy wars.
So you're saying it was a typical Frontier world.

More or less. Living on Coromodir, I heard stories about the problems that many Frontier systems face, but I was detached. I never saw how rough life outside of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAuriganCoalition],Aurigan Coalition]] could get. My uncle's coup changed everything, {COMMANDER.Callsign}… including me.

In part, as a test of your abilities. To make sure that your performance on Coromodir wasn't a fluke.

Our experience in the coup has taught us to be careful, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. We couldn't just reach out to you on faith.

But the Scheria herself is important as well. She isn't just a ship, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. She's a symbol—of reclamation, and rebirth, and the return of better days. She was a majestic vessel once, a true product of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreStarLeague],Star League]]. Under Dr. Murad's care, she will be again.
I imagine you've already guessed. I intend to seek justice for my uncle's crimes. I intend to take my throne back. But I can't do it without you.

We have resources. An army drawn from all across the Frontier.

Perhaps most importantly, we have the patronage of Lady Centrella, and the tacit support of her government. That means money—a great deal of money.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Magistracy of Canopus]</color> My family hails from the Magistracy. I know that my people didn't hold the Aurigan Coalition in especially high regard, so why are they helping you?
The Magistracy is bankrolling you, huh?
As it happens, I like money. A lot. But I assume that Centrella isn't doing this out of the goodness of her heart.
I hadn't realized that the Aurigan Coalition was on such good terms with the Magistracy.

nodes.text:
Because we're useful. The Magistracy sees Kamea's claim to the throne as an asset worth paying for.

They want to see the Directorate dealt with, but it isn't in their interest to do it themselves. They'd prefer to keep their own hands clean.

Unofficially, yes—using Lady Centrella as an intermediary. The Magistracy sees Kamea's claim to the throne as an asset worth paying for.

They want to see the Directorate dealt with, but it isn't in their interest to do it themselves. They'd prefer to keep their own hands clean.

No. The Magistracy sees Kamea's claim to the throne as an asset worth paying for.

They want to see the Directorate dealt with, but it isn't in their interest to do it themselves. They'd prefer to keep their own hands clean.

It wasn't—not really. But they want to see the Directorate dealt with, and it isn't in their interest to do it themselves. They'd prefer to keep their own hands clean.

In light of this, Kamea's claim to the throne is an asset worth paying for.

The Rimward Periphery is a powder keg, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. Tensions between the [[DM.Factions[faction_TaurianConcordat],Taurian Concordat]] and the [[DM.Factions[faction_Davion],Federated Suns]] are high, and my uncle's military posturing could be viewed as a provocation by either side.

If open conflict between superpowers were to erupt, it'd be difficult for anyone to remain neutral. The Magistracy wants to avoid getting dragged into a major war.

And you're [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHouseCentrella],House Centrella]]'s best hope for a clean solution. They fill your war chest, you remove the Directorate from the board, and the Magistracy lets tensions between the Federated Suns and the Taurians simmer down on their own.

Am I reading the situation correctly, Lady Arano?
Correctly enough, Mr. Oliveira. But understand that this isn't just about defusing a dangerous situation. For me, taking on the Directorate is personal.

My uncle betrayed me. The [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreFoundingCouncil],Founding Council]] has been reduced to a handful of powerless figureheads. Our very identity has been cut away and discarded. [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHouseEspinosa],House Espinosa]] is long overdue for a reckoning, and with your help, I will bring them one. Join with me, {COMMANDER.Callsign}, and we will not fail.

branches.responseText: You've already sold me on this, Kamea. I pledge myself and my company to your cause.
Your cause is honorable, Lady Arano. If the price is right, I think we can do business together.
This company is a business, not a charity. If you want us to win you your throne, it's gonna cost you.
We'll be at your side when you need us, Lady Arano.

nodes.text:
I was hoping you'd say that. Of course, you cannot wage war on my behalf with an empty bank account and bare mechbay.

Now that you have pledged yourselves to me, you will be my first choice for contracts—the frontline force in my war to reclaim the throne.

Of course, you will also be paid for every battle you fight at our behest. At a rate that will feel quite generous, given the clientele that you're accustomed to.

Thanks to House Centrella, we have money to burn.

branches.responseText: [Origin: Betrayed] I took down the scum that betrayed my family, Kamea. It seems only right that I help you do the same.
"Money to burn." I like the sound of that.
I'll justify your faith in me, Lady Arano. Together, we'll make Mastiff Montgomery proud.

nodes.text:
I had a feeling you would.

I'll transfer to my own dropship shortly—I have an army to rally and preparations to make. But it won't be long before I contact you again… and when I do, I'll need you ready.

Prepare yourself and your company, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. Our war is about to begin.

I'm pleased that you feel that way. In truth, I feel that Sir Raju is smiling down on us, even now.

I'll transfer to my own dropship shortly—I have an army to rally and preparations to make. But it won't be long before I contact you again… and when I do, I'll need you ready.

Prepare yourself and your company, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. Our war is about to begin.

The price. Of course, {COMMANDER.Callsign}… let us discuss your compensation. You cannot wage war on my behalf with an empty bank account and bare mechbay.

Now that you have pledged yourselves to me, you will be my first choice for contracts—the frontline force in my war to reclaim the throne.

Of course, you will also be paid for every battle you fight at our behest. At a rate that will feel quite generous, given the clientele that you're accustomed to.

Thanks to House Centrella, we have money to burn.

I don't like the thought of being some noble's pawn, but I dolike the sound of money to burn.

This sounds like a pretty good deal, Boss. I'm just sayin'.

branches.responseText: [Origin: Betrayed] I took down the scum that betrayed my family… seems only right that I help you do the same. You've got a deal.
Deal. Let's go make Mastiff Montgomery proud.
"Money to burn." I like the sound of that too. Okay, Lady Arano, we're in.
I'll fight your war for you, but just so we're clear, we're out if the money dries up. Understood?

nodes.text:
Thank you, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. I feel that Raju Montgomery is smiling down on us, even now.

I'll transfer to my own dropship shortly—I have an army to rally and preparations to make. But it won't be long before I contact you again… and when I do, I'll need you ready.

Prepare yourself and your company, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. Our war is about to begin.

He would be. In truth, I feel that he is smiling down on us, even now.

I'll transfer to my own dropship shortly—I have an army to rally and preparations to make. But it won't be long before I contact you again… and when I do, I'll need you ready.

Prepare yourself and your company, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. Our war is about to begin.

Very good. You've made the right decision, {COMMANDER.Callsign}—you'll see that for yourself soon enough.

I'll transfer to my own dropship shortly—I have an army to rally and preparations to make. But it won't be long before I contact you again… and when I do, I'll need you ready. Prepare yourself and your company. Our war is about to begin.

Perfectly. And now that you have accepted my very generous offer, I expect to get my money's worth. And I expect you to treat me with the respect I am due—if not as the rightful High Lady of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAuriganReach],Aurigan Reach]], then as your single most valuable client. Am I understood, Commander?

branches.responseText: Of course, Lady Arano. You will be accorded every courtesy by myself and my crew.
Absolutely. And for the first time in this conversation, you sound like a woman who's ready to go to war.
You'll get what you're paying for, Lady Arano. Don't worry about that.

nodes.text: Then let's leave this unpleasantness behind us and prepare for that war. I'll transfer to my own dropship shortly, {COMMANDER.Callsign}—I have an army to rally. It won't be long before I contact you again, and when I do, I'll need you ready. Prepare yourself and your company. Our war is about to begin.

Good. I'm pleased that there is no ambiguity in our relationship.

I'll transfer to my own dropship shortly—I have an army to rally and preparations to make. But it won't be long before I contact you again… and when I do, I'll need you ready.

Prepare yourself and your company. Our war is about to begin.

I'd expect nothing less, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. You are a mercenary, after all. Of course you cannot wage war on my behalf with an empty bank account and bare mechbay.

Now that you have pledged yourselves to me, you will be my first choice for contracts—the frontline force in my war to reclaim the throne.

I only recently found out you were still alive, {COMMANDER.FirstName}.

And our experience with the coup taught us to be careful - more than one "lost associate" has turned out to be a trap.
